dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my god, you are NOT going to believe this study!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my god, you are N O T going to believe this study!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know! I saw it! Twenty thousand dollars? Like, for ride-hailing? Insane!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! I saw it! Twenty thousand dollars? Like, for ride-hailing? Insane!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Based on data culled from 243,838 economy-level, single rider trips taken in 20 U.S. urban areas, the AAA determined that city dwellers who depend on ride-hailing pay, on average, $20,118 annually (including the occasional use of a rental car for longer excursions).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Twenty grand, exactly! Per year! And that's... that's like, just for ride-hailing, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty grand, exactly! Per year! And that's... that's like, just for ride-hailing, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the AAA determined that city dwellers who depend on ride-hailing pay, on average, $20,118 annually (including the occasional use of a rental car for longer excursions).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! And they said a typical trip, uh, 6.66 miles, was over thirteen bucks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! And they said a typical trip, uh, six point six six miles, was over thirteen bucks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The average user pays $13.15 per trip to travel a typical 6.66 miles.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Thirteen bucks! My car, like, costs me seven thousand a year. For a new car!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Thirteen bucks! My car, like, costs me seven thousand a year. For a new car!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By comparison, the AAAs latest Your Driving Costs report estimates a new car costs an average of $7,321 annually, with 10,841 miles driven (which is the average among those living in urban areas).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! That's what I was thinking! Three times less if you have free parking, they said!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! That's what I was thinking! Three times less if you have free parking, they said!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Needless to say, car owners who have access to free parking come out ahead big time on the deal, paying three times less than ride-hailers for their daily transportation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally! Can you imagine paying eight thousand dollars a year just to park? Hello, New York!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally! Can you imagine paying eight thousand dollars a year just to park? Hello, New York!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On the other hand, if you park a car in New York City, expect to pay a whopping average $8,088 for the privilege.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah, but then there's Phoenix, right? Like, seven hundred bucks. What a difference!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah, but then there's Phoenix, right? Like, seven hundred bucks. What a difference!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The cheapest big-city parking in the nation, according to AAA data, is in Phoenix, AZ, with an average annual cost of $708.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A huge difference! And San Francisco? Over ten thousand! Just for parking!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A huge difference! And San Francisco? Over ten thousand! Just for parking!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's just wild! And they're saying these ride-hailing costs are gonna jump another thirty-five percent?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just wild! And they're saying these ride-hailing costs are gonna jump another thirty-five percent?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Thirty-five percent! It's why public transit is, uh, like, going up, people are flocking to it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Thirty-five percent! It's why public transit is, uh, like, going up, people are flocking to it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, yeah, especially when Bostonians are paying almost twenty-eight thousand a year for it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, yeah, especially when Bostonians are paying almost twenty-eight thousand a year for it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For those keeping score, the AAA says those living in Boston, MA face the highest average ride-hailing costs in the nation at an annual $27,545.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Twenty-eight thousand! Just for ride-hailing! Oh my gosh.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty-eight thousand! Just for ride-hailing! Oh my gosh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Seriously! And a small sedan is only five thousand, like, five hundred a year. What a difference!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seriously! And a small sedan is only five thousand, like, five hundred a year. What a difference!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the AAA s data, owning a small sedan is the cheapest way to get around town at an average $5,492 to drive the aforementioned 10,841 miles,

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So the car is, uh, still king, right? For most people, anyway.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the car is, uh, still king, right? For most people, anyway.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But, for everyone else: the car is still king.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! Unless you just don't drive much, then maybe.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! Unless you just don't drive much, then maybe.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For those who travel a very limited number of miles annually, or have mobility issues that prevent them from driving a personal vehicle, ride-hailing can be a viable and important option, Nielsen says.
